DOC.brief_summary: Gingival Crevicular Fluid samples will be collected using periopapers after accelerated tooth movement technique, results will be achieve with cytokine measurements that will be done using Luminex Assays and cytometer flow
DOC.brief_title: Cytokine Evaluation of Accelerated Tooth Movement
DOC.detailed_description: For this prospective study, 50 individuals will be selected, with skeletal discrepancies randomly divided into two groups: 1 - accelerated tooth movement technique (ATMT) and 2 - Control. Orthodontic records done in two times, initial and preoperative; Gingival Crevicular Fluid samples will be collected using periopapers in 7 times. Flapless cortical perforations will be made in ATMT Group after dental extraction. Surgical protocol will be flapless to preserve periodontal health. After extraction space closure, results will be achieved by cytokine measurements (CCL2/MCP-1,CCL3/MIP-1 alpha, CCL5/RANTES, CXCL8/IL8, IL-1 alpha, IL-1 beta, IL6, TNF-alpha; TRANCE/RANK L, TNF RII) that will be done using Luminex Assays and cytometer flow. After collecting data, the results will be statistically analyzed.
DOC.criteria: Adolescent and adult subjects ages 1655 years old, in good general health, with adult complete dentition, regardless of presence of third molars. Indication for orthognathic surgery Tooth extraction indication for orthodontic treatment Do not smoke Periodontal and teeth healthy Do not use bisphosphonates or corticosteroids Surgically assisted rapid palatal expansion indication Cleft lip and palate Craniofacial syndrome Mental disorder
